lines.Vitus: "I wonder what Zermes thinks about being summoned?"

lines.Volesus: "The great adventurer himself? I'm sure he has a story to tell."

lines.Zermes: "My, my. If it isn't my time to be called on again."
"And the two of you are only wearing towels?"
"I suppose I shouldn't be surprised that it was me who gets called to join in on the lovemaking."

lines.Vitus: "We just want to get to know you better, Zermes."

lines.Zermes: "You're one of those clingy cuddling types."

lines.Volesus: "No, we just want to know more about you."

lines.Zermes: "I might as well change for the occasion then."

lines: (He leaves rather huffily before turning a corner, removing his clothes as noisily as possible.)
(Then he reappears in a towel, and nothing but a towel.)

lines.Vitus: "So how does it feel to be summoned?"

lines.Volesus: "He means how it feels to be called upon at any moment without getting much of a warning."

lines.Zermes: "I have all of eternity to spend it on anything, so I can't really complain about any interruptions."

lines.Volesus: "As somebody with an expiration date, I'm sorry that I can't relate."

lines.Vitus: "Can you relax with us for a day without making somebody want to punch you?"

lines.Zermes: "But really... there's nothing wrong with a little bit of close contact."
